title: URNE Streams "Harken The Waves" Featuring MASTODON's TROY SANDERS
description: It's 10 minutes of destructive riffs. The post URNE Streams "Harken The Waves" Featuring MASTODON's TROY SANDERS appeared first on Metal Injection.
author: Greg Kennelty
byline: By Greg Kennelty Published 7 hours ago
text: Urne is back with a massive new single called "Harken The Waves" featuring Mastodon's own Troy Sanders. And I do mean massive in a pretty literal sense – this single is damn near 10 minutes long. "We feel this is one of the best songs we've ever written," said Urne's Joe Nally. "On top of that, we were lucky enough to have Grammy-winning metal icon Troy Sanders, from the legendary Mastodon, lend his vocal talents. We've grown up listening to Troy and watching Troy live, so having someone like him not only appear, but take on such a significant role in the song, elevating it to another level, means a lot." "Harken The Waves" follows Urne's recently released double A-side "Throes Of Grief" and a cover of Black Sabbath's "I". Check those out below as well alongside Urne's upcoming tour dates, which now include some of Orange Goblin's final shows. Urne only 9/13 London, UK Camden Assembly9/15 Wiesbaden, DE Kesselhaus9/16 Berlin, DE Cassiopeia9/19 Paris, FR La Maroquinerie9/20 Lille, FR Le Grand Mix9/22 Toulouse, FR Le Rex9/23 Lyon, FR Transbordeur Club w/ Orange Goblin 12/10 Glasgow, UK The Garage12/11 Dublin, IE Button Factory12/12 Wolverhampton, UK KK Steel Mills12/13 Manchester, UK Academy 212/14 Bristol, UK SWX12/16 Southampton, UK The 186512/17 London, UK Kentish Town Want More Metal? html:
Urne is back with a massive new single called "Harken The Waves" featuring Mastodon's own Troy Sanders. And I do mean massive in a pretty literal sense – this single is damn near 10 minutes long.

"We feel this is one of the best songs we've ever written," said Urne's Joe Nally. "On top of that, we were lucky enough to have Grammy-winning metal icon Troy Sanders, from the legendary Mastodon, lend his vocal talents. We've grown up listening to Troy and watching Troy live, so having someone like him not only appear, but take on such a significant role in the song, elevating it to another level, means a lot."

"Harken The Waves" follows Urne's recently released double A-side "Throes Of Grief" and a cover of Black Sabbath's "I". Check those out below as well alongside Urne's upcoming tour dates, which now include some of Orange Goblin's final shows.

Urne only

9/13 London, UK Camden Assembly
9/15 Wiesbaden, DE Kesselhaus
9/16 Berlin, DE Cassiopeia

9/23 Lyon, FR Transbordeur Club
